ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course presents the student with the question of a particular mode of meaning construction - that of the collective traumatic experience. Thus, any student who is interested in meaning at a societal collective level will be drawn by the discussions that take place in this course.
A great course on memory and trauma. Take it!

The course is an ongoing discussion of major works about trauma (personal, collective, or cultural), and of the differences between the theorizations of it. I would recommend it for students who are interested more broadly in cultural and historical sociology.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: As my work is directly related to the cultural traumatic experience this course specifically addressed the issues that I will be pursuing in the years to come.
This course furthered my interest in questions of memory and the nation, particularly problematic memory of historical events. These questions will be central to my future research. Thank you!
